metadata.title: CVE-2023-5171 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
During Ion compilation, a Garbage Collection could have resulted in ause-after-free condition, allowing an attacker to write two NUL bytes, andcause a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox <118, Firefox ESR < 115.3, and Thunderbird < 115.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 118.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 118.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 118.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '118.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
